channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for NE
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for NE

item.title: Report X-2024030656
item.description:
Report X-2024030656

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-21T15:13:33+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-13
  • City: LINCOLN
  • State: NE
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: ON PRELOAD THE PACKAGE WAS DISCOVERED ON THE FLOOR OF THE TRAILER. WHEN UNLOADER PLACED PACKAGE ON BELT, NOTICED THE WET LOOKING STAIN ON THE SIDE OF THE PACKAGE. RESPONDER ARRIVED WITH PROPER PPE AND IDENTIFIED THE CONTENTS AS POTENTIALLY HAZARDOUS. SHE CONTAINERIZED THE SPILL AND BROUGHT THE PACKAGE TO THE DMP FOR FURTHER PROCESSING. CALLED HEALTH AND SAFETYTO INQUIRE ABOUT THE STEPS TO PROCESS THIS HAZMAT.

item.title: Report X-2024021645
item.description:
Report X-2024021645

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-18T15:10:48+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-26
  • City: McCook
  • State: NE
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On Feb 26th a package was found during the AM sort that was warm to the touch and had an odor. The package was isolated and upon further investigation of opening the package it was discovered to contain 3 lead acid batteries. One of the batteries was damaged and the evolution of heat caused some scorching on the inside of the package. The package was placed into a steel salvage drum and is awaiting disposition.
